docs.lead_paragraph: For weeks there had been quiet talk in the neighborhood about the tall, polite 13-year-old girl. It had not gone unnoticed that she had recently, and rapidly, gained weight. Rumors began to spread that she must be pregnant. On Friday afternoon, when she stopped in the Staten Island Deli Express for her usual bagel and cream cheese, the gregarious clerk, Elias Guzman, could not help blurting out, ''What happened to you?'' Blushing with embarrassment, she avoided answering and left quickly.

headline.main: S.I. Girl, 13, Faces Charge In the Death of Her Newborn

docs.abstract: Thirteen-year-old girl is to be charged as juvenile in death of her newborn child in her family's apartment on Staten Island; neighbor John Frakes, 19, is charged with statutory rape (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Bob Herbert's excellent summation of potential right-wing accomplishments should a Republican president have the opportunity to replace one or more Supreme Court justices with new ones (column, May 25) brought two thoughts to mind.
docs.abstract: Rita R Brownback letter, commenting on Bob Herbert's May 25 column, expresses anxiety over women's right to abortion if a Republican president should have opportunity to replace one or more Supreme Court justices
